userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Us e your drops as prescribed. I keep them by my bed and put them in nightly as I go to turn off the lamp.

userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

condition.description:
Glaucoma is a group of diseases that can damage the eye's optic nerve. It is a leading cause of blindness in the United States. It usually happens when the fluid pressure inside the eyes slowly rises, damaging the optic nerve. Often there are no symptoms at first. Without treatment, people with glaucoma will slowly lose their peripheral, or side vision. They seem to be looking through a tunnel. Over time, straight-ahead vision may decrease until no vision remains.

A comprehensive eye exam can tell if you have glaucoma. People at risk should get eye exams at least every two years. They include

  • African Americans over age 40
  • People over age 60, especially Mexican Americans
  • People with a family history of glaucoma

There is no cure, but glaucoma can usually be controlled. Early treatment can help protect your eyes against vision loss. Treatments usually include prescription eyedrops and/or surgery.

NIH: National Eye Institute
condition.name: Glaucoma

carousel_items: Don't take this with aspirin without talking to your doctor or pharmacist first.
Can make you tired and drowsy the first few days, so be careful driving or doing anything that requires concentration.
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, make sure to go up in altitude very slowly.
Take Acetazolamide in the morning since you may urinate a lot the first few days.
Can cause numbness and tingling, temporary changes in hearing, changes in appetite, nausea, and diarrhea.

basics.benefits_moa: Acetazolamide is a diuretic that treats edema, glaucoma, seizures, and mountain sickness. It lowers the amount of fluid in the eye, reduces swelling in the legs, and allows the body to use oxygen better at high altitudes.
basics.bottom_line: Acetazolamide is used to treat and prevent mountain sickness, as well as to lower the amount of fluid in the eye and legs.
downsides: If you're using it for swelling of the legs, it's not as good as other water pills, like hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ).
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, try not stay at high altitudes for too long.

downsides_processed.orig: If you're using it for swelling of the legs, it's not as good as other water pills, like hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ).
If you're using Acetazolamide for mountain sickness, try not stay at high altitudes for too long.

upsides: Considered as a first choice treatment for mountain sickness.
Most people don't have many side effects, except for more frequent urination.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be reasonably priced.

upsides_processed.orig: Considered as a first choice treatment for mountain sickness.
Most people don't have many side effects, except for more frequent urination.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be reasonably priced.

drugs.name: Acetazolamide

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Acetazolamide has been shown to be cause birth defects. It should be used in pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the fetus.

description_processed.orig: Acetazolamide has been shown to be cause birth defects. It should be used in pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the fetus.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Severe reactions to drugs like Acetazolamide include skin reactions like Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, liver failure, and blood disorders. If signs of allergic reactions occur, stop using the drug immediately.

description_processed.orig: Severe reactions to drugs like Acetazolamide include skin reactions like Stevens-Johnson syndrome and toxic epidermal necrolysis, liver failure, and blood disorders. If signs of allergic reactions occur, stop using the drug immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Don't take high-dose aspirin with Acetazolamide since cases of anorexia, breathing problems, fatigue, and coma have been reported.

description_processed.orig: Don't take high-dose aspirin with Acetazolamide since cases of anorexia, breathing problems, fatigue, and coma have been reported.

carousel_items: Usual dose is one drop given twice daily
Remove contact lenses and leave them out for 15 minutes after using the drops
If other drops are used at the same time , wait 5 minutes between each medicine

basics.benefits_moa: Combigan is a two medicine combination which treats your eyes for high pressure
basics.bottom_line: An effective control of high pressure within the eye when used alone or with other eye medications. Lowering eye pressure back to normal can prevent the onset of glaucoma.
downsides: The medicine is absorbed into your body and therefore may react to other conditions you have, such as heart or lung conditions

downsides_processed.orig: The medicine is absorbed into your body and therefore may react to other conditions you have, such as heart or lung conditions

upsides: The two medicines do not have to be taken separately

upsides_processed.orig: The two medicines do not have to be taken separately

drugs.one_liner: An eyedrop used to treat increased pressure inside the eye
drugs.name: Combigan

labeled_indications.indication: In patients requiring adjunctive or replacement therapy Ocular hypertension

carousel_items_processed.orig: Usual dose is one drop given twice daily

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems (Cardiovascular Risk)
risks_warnings.description: Combigan is absorbed into your system and can interfere with other drugs you are taking for certain heart condition, such as, irregular heartbeats and  high blood pressure. People with these conditions will not take Combigan.

description_processed.orig: Combigan is absorbed into your system and can interfere with other drugs you are taking for certain heart condition, such as, irregular heartbeats and  high blood pressure. People with these conditions will not take Combigan.

risks_warnings.title: Lung conditions
risks_warnings.description: Combigan is absorbed into your system and can interfere with other drugs you are taking for certain breathing conditions. People with asthma or COPD will not take Combigan.
risk_factors: People with Asthma, COPD, or other breathing conditions

description_processed.orig: Combigan is absorbed into your system and can interfere with other drugs you are taking for certain breathing conditions. People with asthma or COPD will not take Combigan.

risks_warnings.title: Redness in eye
risks_warnings.description: Combigan can irritate the eye after long term use. Notify your doctor if you have redness in the white part of your eye.

description_processed.orig: Combigan can irritate the eye after long term use. Notify your doctor if you have redness in the white part of your eye.

risks_warnings.title: Visual Changes
risks_warnings.description: Notify your doctor if your vision changes in any way.

description_processed.orig: Notify your doctor if your vision changes in any way.

risks_warnings.title: Young children
risks_warnings.description: Combigan is not given to children under the age of 2 years.

description_processed.orig: Combigan is not given to children under the age of 2 years.

carousel_items: Epinephrine comes in an adult dose and child dose autoinjector. Know how to use the injector before you need it by practicing with the sample injector in the Epinephrine kit.

When needed, inject the entire amount of medicine into the upper, outer part of the thigh, through clothing if necessary. If the severe allergic reaction doesn’t go away, the dose can be repeated with a second Epinephrine in 5 to 15 minutes.
It's best to get medical attention immediately, even though you gave the injection.
In overweight or obese people, including children, inject Epinephrine into the lower half of the thigh or calf.
Epinephrine is sensitive to light and air and will turn pink or brown if it goes bad. Don’t inject the solution if it’s discolored or contains solid particles.
Any additional doses will need to be given by a doctor in a healthcare setting.

basics.benefits_moa: Epinephrine is like adrenaline. It relaxes muscles in your lungs and relieves spasm, wheezing, and shortness of breath that happens during a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis).
basics.bottom_line: Epinephrine is a life-saving medication for severe allergic reactions. Just make sure you know how to give an injection before it's needed.
downsides: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

downsides_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you may a greater risk of having side effects from Epinephrine.
You can only use 2 Epinephrine injections to treat a severe allergic reaction. If you need a 3rd dose, it'll have to be given by a doctor in a hospital or healthcare setting.
Injecting Epinephrine into body parts other than the upper/outer thigh can cause serious damage and may not treat your allergic reaction. Never, ever accidentally inject it into your hand.
You should keep two Epinephrine injectors that haven't expired yet with you at all times if you know you have severe allergies to insects, foods, drugs, or other products.

upsides: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.
Can be used immediately to stop a life-threatening allergic reaction.
The Jr. dose is for children 33lbs to 66 lbs. Adults should use the standard Epinephrine.

upsides_processed.orig: Epinephrine is an easy-to-use automatic injector. Just place the injector on the upper/outer part of your thigh and press a button.
Can be used immediately to stop a life-threatening allergic reaction.
The Jr. dose is for children 33lbs to 66 lbs. Adults should use the standard Epinephrine.

It's best to get medical attention immediately, even though you gave the injection.

risks_warnings.title: Severe allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

description_processed.orig: An injection of epinephrine can cause a significant increase in blood pressure.

risks_warnings.title: Emergency treatment
risks_warnings.description: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

description_processed.orig: Injecting Epinephrine is only part of the treatment for a severe allergic reaction. In addition to the one or two injections given by yourself or a family member, you'll need to get immediate medical attention.

risks_warnings.title: Wrong area of injection
risks_warnings.description: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

description_processed.orig: Epinephrine can only be injected into the upper/outer part of the thigh, or for obese individuals, the lower part of thigh or calf. Injecting Epinephrine in other areas of the body can cause serious injury and won't completely treat your allergic reaction.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening heart problems or high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

description_processed.orig: If you have heart disease or high blood pressure, you can have more side effects if you use Epinephrine. It can cause temporary worsening of chest pain and palpitations.

carousel_items: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Phenylephrine can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
It's in other cold and flu combination medicines. Read labels closely so you don't accidentally double up and take too much of it in a day.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days.

basics.benefits_moa: Phenylephrine is a decongestant. It narrows blood vessels and reduces swelling in your nasal passages to make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Phenylephrine is a good medication for relieving stuffy nose. It doesn't work as well as pseudoephedrine (Sudafed), but it has fewer side effects.
downsides: Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine (Sudafed).
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
Can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
Shouldn't use it before you want to sleep.
Not as effective after using it for 4 days in a row.

downsides_processed.orig: Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine (Sudafed).
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
Can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
Shouldn't use it before you want to sleep.
Not as effective after using it for 4 days in a row.

upsides: Works to clear nasal congestion and helps you breathe better.
Helpful in relieving congestion-related headaches.
Has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Doesn't give you rebound congestion (worse symptoms when you stop taking it) like nasal spray decongestants do.

upsides_processed.orig: Works to clear nasal congestion and helps you breathe better.
Helpful in relieving congestion-related headaches.
Has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Doesn't give you rebound congestion (worse symptoms when you stop taking it) like nasal spray decongestants do.

userStories.tip: Doesn't work. Get the real deal, behind the counter pseudo.
Phenylephrine doesn't work. Do the research, read the wikipedia page. You might as well just take a placebo.
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

drugs.name: Phenylephrine

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in 30 minutes.
Phenylephrine can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
It's in other cold and flu combination medicines. Read labels closely so you don't accidentally double up and take too much of it in a day.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Phenylephrine and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Phenylephrine and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Pseudoephedrine can put additional stress on your heart. | Be careful when using it if you have a history of heart problems. Talk to your doctor if another option might be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Pseudoephedrine can put additional stress on your heart. | Be careful when using it if you have a history of heart problems. Talk to your doctor if another option might be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Phenylephrine can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Phenylephrine can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: Wash your hands before putting drops in your eyes.
Don't touch the dropper tip to your eye or with your hands.
If you wear contacts, remove them and wait 15 minutes after putting the drop in your eye, to put your contacts back in.
After putting drops in the eye, press one finger to the inner corner of eye, by the nose, and press lightly for 1 minute.
If using this with another eyedrop medication, wait five minutes between using them.

basics.benefits_moa: Latanoprost reduces high pressure inside the eye. If not treated, the pressure can cause glaucoma and eventual blindness.
basics.bottom_line: Latanoprost lowers high pressure in the eye well and helps prevent glaucoma.
downsides: Latanoprost can turn the colored part of your eye and your eyelashes brown.

downsides_processed.orig: Latanoprost can turn the colored part of your eye and your eyelashes brown.

upsides: It's easy to use and you only need to give yourself one drop each day in the evening.
Can be used along with other eye drops, if needed for better results.
Latanoprost is available generically.
Latanoprost can increase the length, thickness, and number of your eyelashes.

upsides_processed.orig: It's easy to use and you only need to give yourself one drop each day in the evening.
Can be used along with other eye drops, if needed for better results.
Latanoprost is available generically.
Latanoprost can increase the length, thickness, and number of your eyelashes.

userStories.tip: Stick with it.  Good results (5-6 point drop in intraocular pressure) came pretty quickly after starting the drug.  Excellent results (>10 point drop) came after more than 2 years of regular use.

drugs.name: Xalatan

carousel_items_processed.orig: Wash your hands before putting drops in your eyes.
Don't touch the dropper tip to your eye or with your hands.
If you wear contacts, remove them and wait 15 minutes after putting the drop in your eye, to put your contacts back in.
After putting drops in the eye, press one finger to the inner corner of eye, by the nose, and press lightly for 1 minute.
If using this with another eyedrop medication, wait five minutes between using them.

risks_warnings.title: Darkening of lenses
risks_warnings.description: You must wait 15 minutes before replacing contact lenses. If replaced too soon the lenses may darken and be damaged.

description_processed.orig: You must wait 15 minutes before replacing contact lenses. If replaced too soon the lenses may darken and be damaged.

risks_warnings.title: Darkening of lashes
risks_warnings.description: You may see your lashes lengthen, thicken, or darken. You should be aware of this especially if you only apply drops to one eye.

description_processed.orig: You may see your lashes lengthen, thicken, or darken. You should be aware of this especially if you only apply drops to one eye.

carousel_items: Take it with food.
Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and headache.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
This is the immediate release version. It also comes as an extended release form: Toprol XL (metoprolol succinate).

clock.tip: Works better if taken with food.
Works better if taken with food.
Works better if taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

downsides_processed.orig: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Metoprolol tartrate suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.

upsides_processed.orig: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina). Makes pain attacks less frequent and makes it easier to be active without having chest pain.
A first-choice treatment for heart failure. May prevent long-term heart damage.
A first-choice treatment for heart attack. Lowers the risk of death during and after a heart attack.

drugs.one_liner: Lowers blood pressure and controls heart rate.

userStories.tip: it's never given me any problems or dramatic side effects.

Had to try different Metoprolol dosages and then also added Losartan to finally settle on a regime that has kept my blood pressure under control and stable for over 10 years with little side effects. Definitely worth it.
userStories.identifier: HBP and mild heart attack 15 years ago.

userStories.tip: I don't like the fatigue it causes. I've been taking this medication for 6 weeks and it's difficult for me to work out. I do not have the endurance I had before starting this medication. It makes me sluggish and tired.
Schedule dosage at well before activity.  Will sometimes cause drowsiness within an hour for about a half an hour

drugs.name: Lopressor

Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and headache.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.
This is the immediate release version. It also comes as an extended release form: Toprol XL (metoprolol succinate).

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Metoprolol tartrate.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Metoprolol tartrate who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Metoprolol tartrate suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

description_processed.orig: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Metoprolol tartrate. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

description_processed.orig: If you're planning to undergo a major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Metoprolol tartrate, so they can monitor your heart closely.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

carousel_items: Stop using this product if your skin condition gets worse or if a rash develops.
Don't let it get in your eyes, on your lips, or on your nose.
Apply Urea to the affected areas of skin twice a day.
Rub it in until it's completely absorbed.
Wash your hands well each time after applying it.

basics.benefits_moa: Urea softens thickened areas of the skin by gently loosening the horny layer of skin and causing scaly skin to shed.
basics.bottom_line: Urea treats a variety of skin conditions, but shouldn’t be used by children.
downsides: Urea can cause skin stinging, burning, itching, or irritation.
Can't be used by children.
Pregnant women need to talk with their doctors before using Urea.

downsides_processed.orig: Urea can cause skin stinging, burning, itching, or irritation.
Can't be used by children.
Pregnant women need to talk with their doctors before using Urea.

upsides: Urea is useful for treating hyperkeratotic (thickened) skin conditions such as dry, rough skin, skin cracks and fissures, dermatitis, eczema, psoriasis, keratoses, and calluses.
Side effects normally disappear after you stop using Urea.

upsides_processed.orig: Urea is useful for treating hyperkeratotic (thickened) skin conditions such as dry, rough skin, skin cracks and fissures, dermatitis, eczema, psoriasis, keratoses, and calluses.
Side effects normally disappear after you stop using Urea.

surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
surveys.tip: Us e your drops as prescribed. I keep them by my bed and put them in nightly as I go to turn off the lamp.

surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
